page.title: 08The Public House Chailey
page.content: The Five Bells-was called this because it stands right next to the Church which had five bells before 1810.It is very old and developed with the coming of the turnpike. Now it is well known for its food and many people stop for lunch. The Kings Head - is where people from North Chailey drink. It used to have a cattle market opposite and was a busy coaching inn. It is said to be of Elizabethan origin. Every month the landlord holds a raffle and the winner donates the profits to the local charity or cause. The Horns Ledge-used to get beer from the Cooks Bridge Brewery which burnt down in 1920s. Extended in 1983 and every year it has pantomime which is an enormous success. Mr Copping is the landlord and he has local customers from all around village.
